DataElement.preferredName: Gastric Neoplasm Histologic Type Lauren Classification Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The classification of benign and malignant stomach tumors based on the Lauren Classification system.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the stomach._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the stomach.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm involving the stomach.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda). 11/13/19 jk created for CPTAC STAD baseline CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A classification scheme in which gastric adenocarcinomas are separated into diffuse adenocarcinoma, intestinal type adenocarcinoma, mixed adenocarcinoma, or indeterminate type adenocarcinoma._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unable to determine the histologic type.

Concepts.definition: Unable to determine the histologic type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gastric mucosa and is characterized by the presence of both glandular and poorly cohesive malignant cellular components.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the gastric mucosa and is characterized by the presence of both glandular and poorly cohesive malignant cellular components.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.  Grossly, it tends to be nodular, polypoid or ulcerated.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma of the stomach arising on a background of intestinal metaplasia.  Microscopically, it is characterized by a glandular pattern and it closely resembles a colonic adenocarcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the stomach.  Microscopically, it is characterized by the presence of a diffuse infiltrate, composed of individual adenocarcinoma cells or groups of adenocarcinoma cells in a fibrous or mucoid stroma.  Many cells contain mucin droplets, producing a signet-ring configuration.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the stomach.  Microscopically, it is characterized by the presence of a diffuse infiltrate, composed of individual adenocarcinoma cells or groups of adenocarcinoma cells in a fibrous or mucoid stroma.  Many cells contain mucin droplets, producing a signet-ring configuration.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A classification scheme in which gastric adenocarcinomas are separated into diffuse adenocarcinoma, intestinal type adenocarcinoma, mixed adenocarcinoma, or indeterminate type adenocarcinoma.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A classification scheme in which gastric adenocarcinomas are separated into diffuse adenocarcinoma, intestinal type adenocarcinoma, mixed adenocarcinoma, or indeterminate type adenocarcinoma.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda). 11/13/19 jk created for CPTAC STAD baseline CRF.
